answers.answer: could be vitamin defficiency, could be H.pylori, Could be chronic gastroenteritis, could be appendicitis...doubtfull though, could be diabetes, could be lymphonodular hyperplasia...but doubtfull, id go with other infections that the doc might now have ruled out look on web md on the symptom checker see what it says...but look up H. pylori...good possibilty...along with vitamin deffiency

Try having your son take digestive enzymes with his food, proteases with protein, lypase with fats, amylase with carbs. etc. This can solve a lot of problems. A good digestive enzyme complex will have all of these.Slippery elm can soothe the stomach and intestinal tract and is very healing.My other thought was he might have a physical injury. Consider getting a body scan done if it continues, or if he begins to have more pain or other symptoms.Enzy

question: my twelve year old son has been vomiting for the past week.  He says he feels fine and he has a regular appetite.  The only other symptom he has if that he is hurting on his right lower side.  He has had no fever.  The doctor checked his blood and urine this morning and said it all looks fine.  Of course they won't keep him at school when he is vomiting.  What could possibly be wrong that needs to be checked that the Dr. is missing?  This is beginning to concern me and he is really missing a lot of school.
title: vomiting
